summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing a witness's recollection of attending a Broadway play. The correspondence clarifies details about a trip to see 'The Lion King' with Jeffrey Epstein, who bragged about his friendship with Julie Taymor, to verify the timeline against flight records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as having bragged about being good friends with Julie Taymor and providing amazing first row mezzanine seats to 'The Lion King'.

persons.name: Julie Taymor
persons.context: Referenced as a person Jeffrey Epstein claimed to be good friends with; she was the director of 'The Lion King' Broadway play.

connections.description: Epstein bragged about being good friends with Julie Taymor, according to a witness's account in the email.

events.title: Broadway debut of 'The Lion King'
events.description: The musical 'The Lion King' first premiered on Broadway.

events.title: Release of 'The Lion King' movie
events.description: The animated film 'The Lion King' was released and was in theaters through approximately spring 1995.

events.title: Email correspondence about witness timeline
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel exchanged emails to clarify a witness's account of attending 'The Lion King' with Jeffrey Epstein, comparing it to flight records to establish a timeline.

keyFacts: A witness recalled attending 'The Lion King' with Jeffrey Epstein, who bragged about being good friends with director Julie Taymor and had obtained first row mezzanine seats.
The correspondence aims to clarify whether the witness saw the Broadway play (debut 1997) or the movie (released 1994) to verify the timeline of her first trip to New York against flight records.
The email chain is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs, indicating sensitive information related to the investigation.
The discussion occurred in March 2020, with the participants noting the context of the COVID-19 pandemic ('before the world imploded').
